title: High ping during prime time
body: Every night between 7:30pm - 10:00pm MTN I get almost exactly 150-160 ping which is impossible to outplay anyone with. My poor teams that are unable to carry me. Every other time I get 40 ping. I am using fiber optic and I run speed test showing that I'm getting 100 mps and other games are at 40 ping at the same time. Does Nebraska get lower priority during prime time or what's going on?

replies.body:
I agree with Khelb that getting some routing during this period can help a lot, and one during the off-time as well.  I'm guessing that your ISP might be changing how it's routing you to our game servers.  Download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a traceroute to 104.160.131.1

In the meantime, you can also run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to rule out any local possibilities.  Let me know if you have any questions!

hey man,

I've been struggling with this issue for a little bit now and support is aware of it and working on a fix.  No ETA of the fix yet, but the support person helping me mentioned how important it is to have data.  That said, if you can run a WinMTR and post it here, i doubt it's going to hurt anything.

Edit:  The host address I've been instructed to enter in WinMTR is 104.160.131.1
